ThingDef.label: ripper
ThingDef.description: A small chainsaw similar to a combat knife in appearance and function. This version is often used by raiders and features duct tape around the grip. Despite its small size it’s quite effective against heavily armoured targets. It can also be used as a tool to cut plants or meat.

ThingDef.label: buzzsaw
ThingDef.description: An ice or climbing axe with a buzzsaw blade attached to it. A cumbersome but devastating weapon that can easily cut through armor, flesh, plant matter and just about any other material. It’s often used by high-ranking and/or insane raiders.

ThingDef.label: crowbar
ThingDef.description: A crowbar with pieces of a round sawblade attached to one end, sometimes built and used by raiders. Due to its blade, it can deal blunt and sharp damage simultaneously and can prove to be devastating in the right hands. It’s also useful as a construction tool.

ThingDef.label: baseball bat
ThingDef.description: A baseball bat with rivets on its barrel and duct tape around the grip. A slow but hard-hitting weapon favoured by raiders, wastelanders and others with limited access to advanced weaponry. Useful for incapacitating opponents without inflicting deep wounds.

ThingDef.label: scissor pipe
ThingDef.description: A homemade weapon composed of a pair of scissors duct taped to a metal pipe. While it’s somewhat unwieldy, it is capable of dealing sharp and blunt damage at the same time. Quite an adaptable, if crude, weapon.

ThingDef.label: wack saw
ThingDef.description: A makeshift weapon made of a thin sawblade attached to a metal pipe with duct tape wrapped around the handle to offer increased grip. A dangerous weapon and a useful tool for cutting or harvesting plants.

ThingDef.label: throat cutter
ThingDef.description: A vicious and aptly named weapon often used by raiders. It’s composed of a combat knife duct taped to some brass knuckles. It’s extremely sharp and capable of inflicting terrible, often fatal lacerations.

ThingDef.label: wrench knife
ThingDef.description: A knife blade crudely duct taped to a wrench. While it doesn’t look like much, it’s still capable of inflicting deep cuts and can furthermore assist its user with constructing and deconstructing structures.

ThingDef.label: sishkebab
ThingDef.description: A raider version of the Shishkebab, a short sword with a built-in mechanism which coats the blade in gasoline and ignites it. In addition to the cutting of the sharp blade, it’s capable of setting opponents on fire and, quite literally, melting through their armor.

ThingDef.label: MPL
ThingDef.description: A machine pistol with a bayonet attached under the barrel. Due to its small frame, it’s best used over sort distances as it quickly becomes inaccurate when used against far away targets. It’s not very powerful against armored targets, but easy to make and the bayonet offers tactical variety for close-quarter combat.

ThingDef.label: Tomacuzzi
ThingDef.description: A stocky machinegun cobbled together from various machinegun parts and often used by mercenaries and raiders. Like most weapons of its size, it’s most effective over short range as it becomes inaccurate rather quick otherwise. It’s not very effective against heavily armored targets but still fairly common due to its low price and high rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: sawn off shotgun
ThingDef.description: A crude, homemade shotgun with a shortened barrel and a pistol grip. It’s devastating up close but nearly useless against far away targets. Due to its small size, it can be reloaded and fired rather quick for a shotgun and it’s a common sight among raiders, especially those who prefer it up close and personal.

ThingDef.label: pumpie
ThingDef.description: A compact pump action shotgun made from various parts of similar weapons. Like all shotguns it’s powerful up close. A common sight with raiders and many other wastelanders due to its rugged and dependable nature.

ThingDef.label: kalash rifle
ThingDef.description: A homemade assault rifle with a shovel handle serving as its stock. Despite its ramshackle appearance it’s a well-performing versatile weapon. It’s accurate over medium distances but less so against targets close up or far away. It’s fairly common among raiders who favour shooting their prey instead of bashing in skulls.

ThingDef.label: makeshift AMR
ThingDef.description: An anti-materiel rifle custom-made from spare parts and hunting rifles by groups with no access to military-grade sniper rifles, like raiders and caravaneers. While it is no match to a regular pre-war AMR it still is a powerful weapon capable of punching through all but the heaviest armors and is especially useful against the armored shells of robots.

ThingDef.label: nikov rifle
ThingDef.description: A rugged, worn looking home-made assault rifle with a curved, duct taped magazine favoured by militias and mercenaries. It’s versatile, but best used over medium distances and packs quite a punch but sacrifices some rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: syringer
ThingDef.description: A rare and strange weapon, the syringer is a homemade, gas-operated weapon propelling a dart coated in a strong hallucinogen. If the dart penetrates the victim’s skin it sends it into a bout of uncontrolled, murderous rage where it can no longer differentiate friends from enemies. Due to the syringer’s nature it is nearly useless against armoured targets, as the darts are unlikely to penetrate anything but skin. It is sometimes used by sadistic raiders or those who revel in the confusion and chaos it can create.

ThingDef.label: Bulldog
ThingDef.description: A ramshackle looking revolver often carried by traders, made from gun parts and various scrap meatal. It fires slowly, but does a suprisingly large amount of damage. Its also verry accurate over short range, but significantly less so againt far away targets.

ThingDef.label: Stapler
ThingDef.description: A strange weapon cobbled together from parts of an industrial stapler gun and a machine pistol. It fires extremly quickly and can inflict a painful wound, if one manages to actually hit something, since its exceedingly inaccurate. An ideal spray-and-prey weapon, its quite popular with traders and caravan guards who favor quantity over quality.

ThingDef.label: Scrap Pistol
ThingDef.description: A cheap, basic semi-automatic handgun often made and carried by traders and other civilians for self-defence purposes. Its range and damage potential are limited, but its quite accurate and fires comparatively quickly.

ThingDef.label: Junk Pistol
ThingDef.description: A primitive automatic pistol cobbled together from various weaponparts and scrap, hold together by screws and duct tape. its cheap and easy to make, even by inexperienced weaponsmiths. While it fires fast, it lacks stopping power, accuracy, and range. A simple weapon used by poor or unsophisticated raiders.

ThingDef.label: Ratvolver
ThingDef.description: A homemade revolver mainly used by raider gangs, with a knifes blade attached under the barrel. its a simple weapon with mediocre damage per shot, low rate of fire and a rather short range. its quite accurte however and an adequate weapon for inexperienced raiders. The blade servers as a makeshift bayonet, giving the wielder an advantage in melee.

ThingDef.label: Nailgun
ThingDef.description: A pneumatic nail gun repurposed as a weapon by raiders. Some nails have been attached to the front of the gun to serve as a makeshift baonet in close combat. Despite being a contruction tool irs a surprisingly adequate weapon thatnks to its hgh rate of fire and low recoil. However, its of little use against heavily armored targets and has a rather limited range.

ThingDef.label: Hunting Rifle
ThingDef.description: A bolt-action hunting rifle often used by traders and caravaneers for hunting and as a substitute sniper rifle.

ThingDef.label: Owne Rifle
ThingDef.description: A makeshift compact machine gun inspired by an anchient weapon of Austrailian design. It features two handles for increased stablity, a large stock and a top-mounted magazine.

ThingDef.label: Pipe Rifle
ThingDef.description: A primitive homemade rifle composed of metal pipes and wooden parts, feauring a curved magazine.

ThingDef.label: Blowback
ThingDef.description: An exceptionally primitive looking rifle craftedand used by various raider gangs. While it unmistakably features some gun parts, most of its parts are made from scrap metal. It should not be underestimated though since this automatic blowback-operated rifle can lay down a hail of bullets.

ThingDef.label: Pipe Rifle R
ThingDef.description: A makeshift rifle made from pipes and other scrap metal parts. It features a bayonet for close combat.

ThingDef.label: SVT
ThingDef.description: A semi-automatic battle rifle based in an anchient soviet design. The original model of the weapon was most certainly looted from a pre-war museum by a gang of raiders who copied the design for its robust and simple construction since a few of them have any actual training.
